entry.name: jQuery.merge
entry.title: jQuery.merge()
entry.desc: Merge the contents of two arrays together into the first array.

argument.name: first
argument.desc: The first array to merge, the elements of second added.

argument.name: second
argument.desc: The second array to merge into the first, unaltered.

longdesc.p: The $.merge() operation forms an array that contains all elements from the two arrays. The orders of items in the arrays are preserved, with items from the second array appended. The $.merge() function is destructive. It alters the first parameter to add the items from the second.
If you need the original first array, make a copy of it before calling $.merge(). Fortunately, $.merge() itself can be used for this duplication:
This shortcut creates a new, empty array and merges the contents of oldArray into it, effectively cloning the array.
Prior to jQuery 1.4, the arguments should be true Javascript Array objects; use $.makeArray if they are not.
